page.title: 10Home Life in Four Oaks.
page.content: More than half our mothers work outside the home,but that doesnot mean our fathers do more jobs to help. Some fathers do share the household jobs but it is mostly the mothers wo do the washing, washing up, ironing, cooking and shopping. Machines give mothers time to go to work.Every family,except one, has a washing machine.That one mother uses the launderette instead.About half of our families have a dishwasher,and over a third have a microwave cooker.Family Holidays in this country are more popular than abroad.About half our families own either a caravan, a boat or a holiday home.A few have villas abroad. Diaries were kept over a Bank Holiday weekend and a lot of families went away. The others had family days out. Visiting Sutton Park,picnics and barbeques were expecially popular.
